name: market for hard coal | hard coal | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/4725/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for  'hard coal', in the geography of Indonesia.;This dataset covers the average transport distance specific to the domestic market of hard coal in Indonesia. Dust from transport and load/unload operations is included. Average coal losses are considered. Average emissions to water due to leaching from coal heaps at storage is estimated from the literature.;hard coal' is a fossil fuel with a calorific value of 27.91 MJ/kg. It is used as a solid fuel and is sourced from coal mines after crushing, screening and washing the coal. Its main applications are in the following sectors: domestic fuel (mainly for hand-fired stoves), as filter media and as an ingredient in charcoal briquettes.

This activity starts at the hard coal preparation plant with the beneficiated coal ready to be loaded on rail, truck, barge or conveyor.

activity end: The activity ends with the unloading of hard coal at domestic consumers or export hubs.
category: B:Mining and quarrying/05:Mining of coal and lignite/051:Mining of hard coal/0510:Mining of hard coal

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Transport distances are geography specific, losses and related emissions are generic values applicable worldwide.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Transport data geography specific, emissions, losses, energy and land requirements are generic assumptions.

exchanges.description: EcoSpold01Location=WEU

flow.name: hard coal
flow.category: B:Mining and quarrying/05:Mining of coal and lignite/051:Mining of hard coal/0510:Mining of hard coal

exchanges.description: Assumption by Dones, R., Bauer, C., Röder, A. (2007) Kohle. In: Dones, R. (Ed.) et al., Sachbilanzen von Energiesystemen: Grundlagen für den ökologischen Vergleich von Energiesystemen und den Einbezug von Energiesystemen in Ökobilanzen für die Schweiz. Final report ecoinvent No. 6-VI, Paul Scherrer Institut Villigen, Swiss Centre for Life Cycle Inventories, Dübendorf, CH.

This value is an informed estimate using maps of Indonesian coal infrastructure (Noble Group, 2014) and previous research (Belanina, 2013; Center for Clean Air Policy, 2011). Belanina (2013) mentions that in the past coal mining sites in Indonesia were located directly at the coasts with transport distances no higher than 35km. Nowadays, mines further inland are in operation and transport distances go beyond 75km, reaching up to 500km for the Indonesian market. The Nobel Group Coal map of Indonesia suggests rail and inland waterway transport, with distances ranging roughly from 280 to 450km for mines not located at the coast.
No information was found on the modal split, therefore we here assume that half of coal is transported via rail and half via inland water ways over 300km. An average 50km road transport and 10km conveyor transport is assumed for transport from mine to coast or mine to river/railway.
Reference(s):
Noble Group. 2014. Coal map of Indonesia, 2014 edition. Accessed online at http://www.coaltrans.com/pdfs/Coal_Map_Indonesia.pdf, 13 November 2017. 
Belanina, E. 2013. Multimodal coal transportation in Indonesia. Master thesis in Urban, Port and Transport Economics,Erasmus University Rotterdam, accessed online at: https://thesis.eur.nl/pub/14848/MA-thesis-Belanina-FINAL-report-on-Indonesia.pdf, 13 November 2017
Center for Clean Air Policy. 2011. Indonesia's power sector: clean coal policy analysis. Accessed online at: http://ccap.org/assets/INDONESIAS-POWER-SECTOR-CLEAN-COAL-POLICY-ANALYSIS_CCAP-March-2011.pdf, 13 November 2017

exchanges.description:
Assumption by Dones et al.: per one time of unloading from transport mode, (storing) and loading on subsequent transport mode an average demand (electric) energy of 7.2 kWh/tonne and an average land use demand of 1m2*a/tonne is required.
Reference(s):
Dones, R., Bauer, C., Röder, A. (2007) Kohle. In: Dones, R. (Ed.) et al., Sachbilanzen von Energiesystemen: Grundlagen für den ökologischen Vergleich von Energiesystemen und den Einbezug von Energiesystemen in Ökobilanzen für die Schweiz.
